sections.heading: Who can get Family benefits
paragraphs: Spouses, ex-spouses, children, and some grandchildren may be eligible for Family benefits. We consider age, marital status, and other factors when we determine eligibility.

sections.heading: What you could get
paragraphs: You could get up to half of your family member’s benefit amount and may be eligible for Medicare based on their work history.

sections.heading: What you need to report
paragraphs: To make sure you get the right payments, tell us about updates, like marriage, school, and income changes.

subpages.title: What to report if you get Family benefits | SSA

sections.heading: Report changes to your personal information
Request to keep benefits when a child turns 18
paragraphs: If a child turns age 18 and is still in school (K–12), use the Advance Notice of Termination of Child's Benefits (Form SSA-1372) (PDF) to ask to keep their benefits.
